title: Old-Fashioned Mindset Test
description: How old-fashioned is your mindset? Take this honest self-assessment!

questions.question: When a junior suggests a new approach?

choices.text: Accept it if it's a good idea
Say it probably won't work based on experience
I tried that, it doesn't work
Need to lead to feel satisfied

questions.question: How often do you say "Kids these days..."?

choices.text: Tell them to do it my way
Do it myself out of frustration

questions.question: When giving advice, you usually say?

choices.text: From my experience, this is right
Do as I say. You'll thank me later
Understand but sometimes wish for more
In my day, we worked all night...

questions.question: When someone has a different opinion?

choices.text: Try to convince them I'm right

questions.question: How often do you say "Back in my day..."?
When a junior makes a mistake?

choices.text: It's okay, do better next time
That's why you should listen to me

questions.question: When learning new technology or tools?
How often do you give compliments?

results.title: Cool Senior (0% Old-Fashioned)
results.description: Congratulations! You're far from being old-fashioned - you're a cool senior! You're open-minded, accepting diverse opinions, and respectful of generational differences. You're a role model for juniors. Keep it up!
results.advice: You're perfect as you are! Keep communicating with younger generations and learning from each other.

results.title: Mild Senior (25% Old-Fashioned)
results.description: You're generally open-minded but occasionally show slight old-fashioned tendencies. The good news is you're self-aware and can control it! With a bit more attention, you can be the perfect senior.
results.advice: Before sharing your thoughts, try listening to others completely. Small differences make big changes!

results.title: Senior Tendency (60% Old-Fashioned)
results.description: Some caution needed! It's understandable to want to share wisdom from experience, but sometimes it may feel like imposition. Recognizing the line between advice and interference is important.
results.advice: Advice only when asked! Watching without intervening is also caring. Try accepting differences.

results.title: True Old-Fashioned (100%)
results.description: To be honest... your old-fashioned level is quite high! How about letting go of the idea that your experience and methods are the best? The world changes, and there's no single right answer.
results.advice: No more 'back in my day'! Start asking juniors, 'How do you do it these days?' This one phrase can change relationships.
